OscillatorNode.summary: The OscillatorNode interface represents a periodic waveform, such as a sine wave. It is an audio-processing module that causes a specified frequency of a given wave to be createdâ€”in effect, a constant tone.

OscillatorNodeDetune.summary: The detune property of the interface is an a-rate representing detuning of oscillation in cents.

blockquote.para: Though the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

OscillatorNodeFrequency.summary: The frequency property of the interface is an a-rate representing the frequency of oscillation in hertz.

blockquote.para: Though the AudioParam returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.

OscillatorNodeOscillatorNode.summary:
The OscillatorNode() constructor of the Web Audio API creates a new
object which is an that
represents a periodic waveform, like a sine wave, optionally setting the node's
properties' values to match values in a specified object.

remarks.para:
If the default values of the properties are acceptable, you can optionally use the
factory method instead; see
Creating an AudioNode.

OscillatorNodeSetPeriodicWave.summary:
The setPeriodicWave() method of the interface is used to point to a
defining a periodic waveform that can be used to shape the oscillator's output, when
is custom.

OscillatorNodeType.summary:
The type property of the interface specifies what shape of waveform the
oscillator will output. There are several common waveforms available, as well as an
option to specify a custom waveform shape. The shape of the waveform will affect the
tone that is produced.
OscillatorNodeType.value:
A string specifying the shape of oscillator wave. The different
available values are:
